gurmukhi: piRQm Agn ky nwm lY AMq Sbid Air dyhu ] Anuj sUqir aucir nwm bwn liK lyhu ]150]
transliteration: Pritham Agad Ke Naam Lai Ant Shabad Ar(i) Deh(u)|| Tanuj Anuj Kah(i) Ar(i) Ouchar(i) Naam Baan Lakh(i) Leh(u)||150||
translation: Uttering primarily “Agni” (fire), then adding “Ar” and afterwards speaking the words “Tanuj, and Sutari”, the names of Baan are known.150.

gurmukhi: piRQm Agn ky nwm lY AMq Sbd Air BwKu ] qnuj Anuj kih Air aucir nwm bwn liK rwKu ]151]
transliteration: Pritham Agad Ke Naam Lai Ant Shabad Ar(i) Bhaakh(u)|| Tanuj Anuj Kah(i) Ar(i) Ouchar(i) Naam Baan Lakh(i) Raakh(u)||151||
translation: Naming “Agni” primarily, then adding “Ari” and afterwards saying “Tanuj, Anuj and Ari”, the names of Baan are spoken.151

gurmukhi: piRQm Agn ky nwm lY Air Air pid puin dyhu ] qnuj Anuj kih Air aucir nwm bwn liK lyhu ]152]
transliteration: Pritham Agad Ke Naam Lai Ar(i) Ar(i) Pad(i) Poun(i) Deh(u)|| Tanuj Anuj Kah(i) Ar(i) Ouchar(i) Naam Baan Lakh(i) Raakh(i)||152||
translation: Uttering primarily the names of Agni, then adding “Ari-Ari” and afterwards saying “Tanuj, Anuj and Ari”, the names of Baan are spoken.152.

gurmukhi: pwvkwr AgnwNq kr kih Air Sbd bKwn ] Air kih Anuj qnuj aucir sUqir bwn pCwn ]153]
transliteration: Paavkaar Agnaant Kar Kah(i) Ar(i) Shabad Bhakhaan|| Ar(i) Kah(i) Anuj Tanuj Ouchar(i) Sootar Baan Pachhaad||153||
translation: Saying “Paavkari and Agnant” and then uttering “Anuj Tanuj and Sutari”, the names of Baan are recognized.153.

gurmukhi: ihmbwr bkhw gdI BIm Sbd puin dyhu ] qnuj Anuj sUqru aucir nwm bwn liK lyhu ]154]
transliteration: Himbaar Bak-haa Gadibheem Shabad Poun(i) Deh(u)|| Tanuj Anuj Sootar(u) Ouchar(i) Naam Baan Lakh(i) Leh(u)||154||
translation: By adding the works “Tanuj, Anuj and Sutari” to the words “Himvari, Bak-haa, Gadi and Bheem”, the names of Baan are known.154.

gurmukhi: durjoDn ky nwm lY AMqu Sbd Air dyhu ] Anuj aucir sUqru aucir nwm bwn liK lyhu ]155]
transliteration: Durjodhan Ke Naam Lai Ant Shabad Ar(i) Deh(u)|| Anuj Ouchar(i) Sootar(i) Ouchar(i) Naam Baan Lakh(i) Leh(u)||155||
translation: By adding the word “Ari” with the name of Duryodhna and then uttering the words “Anuj and Sutari, the names of Baan are known.155.

gurmukhi: AMD suqn ky nwm lY AMq Sbd Air BwKu ] Anuj aujir sUqir aucir nwm bwn liK rwKu ]156]
transliteration: Andh Soutan Ke Naam Lai Ant Shabad Ar(i) Bhaakh(u)|| Anuj Ouchar(i) Sootar(i) Ouchar(i) Naam Baan Lakh(i) Raakh(u)||156||
translation: After uttering the names of the sons of Dhritrashtra, then adding the word “Ari” at the end and afterwards speaking “Anuj and Sutari”, the names of Baan are known.156.

gurmukhi: du`swsn durmuK dRujY kih Air Sbd bKwn ] Anuj aucir sUqir aucir nwm bwn pihcwn ]157]
transliteration: Doussaasan Durmoukh Drujai Kah(i) Ar(i) Shabad Bakhaan|| Anuj Ouchar(i) Sootar(i) Ouchar(i) Naam Baan Paichaan||157||
translation: After uttering the words “Dushasan, Surmukh and Durvijay”, then adding “Ari” and afterwards saying “Anuj and Sutari”, the names of Baan are recognized.157.

gurmukhi: dslw kriBK Awid kih AMq Sbd Air BwKu ] Anuj qnuj sUqir aucir nwm bwn liK rwKu ]158]
transliteration: Daslaa Karbhikh Aadh Kah(i) Ant Shabad Ar(i) Bhaakh(u)|| Anuj Tanuj Sootar(i) Ouchar(i) Naam Baan Lakh(i) Raakh(u)||158||
translation: Saying primarily the words Dashla and Karbhikh (the sons of Dhritrashtra), and then uttering “Ari, Anuj, Tanuj and Sutari”, the names of Baan are known.158.

gurmukhi: piRQm BIKm ky nwm lY AMq Sbd Air dyhu ] S`qRu Awid AMqr aucir nwm bwn liK lyhu ]159]
transliteration: Pritham Bheekhan Ke Naam Lai Ant Shabad Ar(i) Deh(u)|| Shattru Aadh Antar Ouchar(i) Naam Baan Lakh(i) Leh(u)||159||
translation: Placing primarily the names of Bhisham and then adding the words “Ari and Shatru”, the names of Baan are known.159.

gurmukhi: qtq jwnvI AgRjw piRQmY Sbd bKwn ] qnuj S`qRu sUqir aucir nwm bwn pihcwn ]160]
transliteration: Tatat Jaanviagrajaa Prithmai Shabad Bakhaan|| Tanuj Shattru Sootar(i) Ouchar(i) Naam Baan Paihchaan||160||
translation: Saying primarily “Jaahnavi and Agraja ns then uttering “Tanuj, Shatru and Sutari.”, the names of Baan are recognized.160.

gurmukhi: gMgw igrjw piRQm kih pu`qR Sbd puin dyhu ] S`qR aucir sUqir aucir nwm bwn liK lohu ]161]
transliteration: Gadgad Girjaa Pritham Kah(i) Pouttra Shabad Poun(i) Deh(u)|| Shattru Ouchar Sootar(i) Ouchar(i) Naam Baan Lakh(i) Leh(u)||161||
translation: Saying primarily “Ganga and Girija”, then adding the word “Putra” and afterwards uttering “Shatru and Sutari”, the names of Baan are known.161.

gurmukhi: nwkwly sirqysrI piRQmY Sbd aucwr ] sq Air kih sUqir aucir sB sr nwm aucwir ]162]
transliteration: Naakaale Sar(i)tesariprithmai Shabad Ouchaar|| Sat Ar(i) Kah(i) Sootar Ouchar(i) Sabh Sar Naam Oucdaar(i)||162||
translation: Uttering primarily the words, “Nakaale and Sarteshvari” and then saying the words “Shat-ari and Sutari”, all the names of Baan are pronounced.162.

gurmukhi: BIKm SwNqnu suq aucir pun Air Sbd bKwn ] sUq aucir AMqir aucir nwm bwn pihcwn ]163]
transliteration: Bheekham Shaantan(u) Sout Ouchar(i) Poun Ar(i) Shabad Bakhaan|| Soot Ouchar(i) Antar(i) Ouchar(i) Naam Baan Paihchaan||163||
translation: Uttering the words “Bhisham and Shantanu”, then adding “Ari” and afterwards saying the words “Sutari”, the names of Baan are recognized.163.
